title: Three-Body Recombination of Ultracold Microwave-Shielded Polar Molecules
authors:
Ian Stevenson, Shayamal Singh, Ahmed Elkamshishy, Niccol\'o Bigagli,
  Weijun Yuan, Siwei Zhang, Chris H. Greene, and Sebastian Will
abstract:
A combined experimental and theoretical study is carried out on the
three-body recombination process in a gas of microwave-shielded polar
molecules. For ground-state polar molecules dressed with a strong microwave
field, field-linked bound states can appear in the intermolecular potential. We
model three-body recombination into such bound states using classical
trajectory calculations. Our results show that recombination can explain the
enhanced loss rates observed at small microwave detunings in trapped samples of
bosonic NaCs [Bigagli, $\textit{et al.}$, Nat. Phys. $\textbf{19}$ 1579-1584
(2023)]. Specifically, our calculations reproduce the experimentally measured
three-body loss rates across a wide range of microwave Rabi couplings,
detunings, and temperatures. This work suggests that for bosonic shielded
molecular systems in which the two-body loss is sufficiently suppressed and a
field-linked bound state is present, the dominant loss process will be
three-body recombination.
